metadata.title: CVE-2022-22629 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
A buffer overflow issue was addressed with improved memory handling. Thisissue is fixed in macOS Monterey 12.3, Safari 15.4, watchOS 8.5, iTunes12.12.3 for Windows, iOS 15.4 and iPadOS 15.4, tvOS 15.4. Processingmaliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22629` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.36.0-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.36.0-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.36.0-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.36.0-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.36.0-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37-gtk2 - 2.36.0-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.36.0-0ubuntu0.20.04.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.36.0-0ubuntu0.20.04.3').
qtwebkit-opensource-src package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
wpewebkit package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
